intro: Caucalis elongata, commonly known as the elongated bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often ascending stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Caucalis elongata is native to regions in Europe and parts of Asia, often growing in moist meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
